pullRequest.title: DecodeHexBenchmark is too branch-predictor friendly
pullRequest.bodyText:
Motivation:
DecodeHexBenchmark needs to be less branch-predictor friendly
to mimic the "real" behaviour while decoding
Modifications:
DecodeHexBenchmark uses a larger sets of inputs, picking them at
random on each iteration and the benchmarked method is made !inlineable
Result:
DecodeHexBenchmark is more trusty while showing the performance
difference between different decoding methods

commit.message:
DecodeHexBenchmark is too branch-predictor friendly

Motivation:

DecodeHexBenchmark needs to be less branch-predictor friendly
to mimic the "real" behaviour while decoding

Modifications:

DecodeHexBenchmark uses a larger sets of inputs, picking them at
random on each iteration and the benchmarked method is made !inlineable

Result:

DecodeHexBenchmark is more trusty while showing the performance
difference between different decoding methods

Reduced GC, used a fixed seed to generate strings and used
Fisher–Yates shuffle on input string

nodes.bodyText: why long not int? and I guess something like ^= might be cheaper than +=? (maybe insignificant though...)

commit.message: Switching to an higher number of inputs and simplified nextHexDigits
